basics.name: Rahmat Ullah, Ph.D
basics.label: Lecturer in Computer Science
basics.summary: Lecturer in Computer Science specialising in computational imaging, biomedical signal processing, and machine learning for digital health. My research targets non-invasive detection and monitoring of neurodegenerative disease, with a particular emphasis on Alzheimer’s disease using data-driven microwave imaging. I completed my PhD at the University of Edinburgh in collaboration with clinical neuroscientists, developing imaging pipelines for translational healthcare applications. I have teaching and research experience across multiple UK institutions (the University of Essex, University of South Wales, and University of Edinburgh) and I am a Fellow of the Higher Education Academy, with publications in international journals and conferences.

highlights: Module leader and lecturer for undergraduate and postgraduate courses in software engineering and computer science, including group project modules and large-scale software systems & Extreme Programming.
Design, assessment, and moderation of coursework and examinations for cohorts exceeding 200 students.
Supervision of undergraduate and MSc dissertation projects.
Active researcher within the Brain-Computer Interface and Future Health & Technology group, with a focus on digital health and biomedical signal processing.
Contribution to grant writing and collaborative research projects.
